programme.desc: Part one of two. A bizarre archaeological discovery suggests Data somehow met his death in 19th-century San Francisco _ and a freak accident transports the android back in time to that location. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart and Brent Spiner

programme.desc: The British ambassador to a Scandinavian country is abducted, sparking off an audacious rescue mission as a determined security chief refuses to negotiate, deciding instead to take a more direct approach. Drama, starring Sean Connery, Ian McShane, Norman Bristow and John Cording

programme.title: The Twilight Zone

programme.title: Five Guns West (1954)
programme.desc: Five convicted outlaws, all facing the gallows, are offered a last minute reprieve by the Confederacy - provided they undertake a dangerous mission. An intelligence agent has switched sides to support the North, and must be captured alive, along with the shipment of gold he's carrying. But the temptation to run off with the loot is hard to resist. Western, starring John Lund, Dorothy Malone, Touch Connors and Paul Birch

Thriller, starring Stephen Dorff, Chyler Leigh and Tom Berenger

programme.title: The Sally Lockhart Mysteries
programme.desc: Billie Piper stars in this adaptation of award-winning novelist Philip Pullman's first in a quartet of books about Victorian heroine Sally Lockhart. Sixteen-year-old Sally has little in the way of academic knowledge, but has a thorough grounding in military tactics, can ride like the wind and shoot straight with a pistol. So when her father dies in mysterious circumstances during a voyage to the South China Sea, and a letter arrives soon after containing a strange warning, it becomes clear that Sally is in danger and will need to draw on all her skills. The stellar cast also includes Julie Walters, Robert Glenister, David Harewood, Ramon Tikaram, JJ Feild and Don Gilet. Adapted for the screen by Bafta-winning writer Adrian Hodges (Charles II, Rome, The Lost World)

Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt

programme.desc: The former leader of an Irish Republican group comes forward with information regarding the abduction and subsequent disappearance of an 18-year-old woman in 1983, prompting the team to reopen the case. The reformed dissident claims the rebels used the kidnapping to raise their profile, but his subsequent reinvention as a politician and man of peace leaves Sandra and her colleagues suspicious of his motives. They also investigate whether the arms-manufacturing activities of the victim's father could have made her a target. Crime drama, guest starring Sian Phillips and Annette Crosbie, with Amanda Redman and James Bolam

programme.desc: TV celebrity designer Catherine Earlham arrives in Larkhall after embezzling money from a pension fund and promptly gets the inmates scrubbing the place clean for an 'at home' makeover feature. programme.desc: The story of Margaret Haig Thomas, one of Wales' most prominent suffragettes, the shy girl from Monmouthshire who became a militant campaigner for the vote for women. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.desc: A mother of a young toddler calls on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to breath some life and vibrancy into a dull dining space. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton guides a pair of budding entrepreneurs who want to escape to the Cotswolds. They have a generous £900,000 to play with, but the property must have the potential to develop a boutique country holiday let. Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track

His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for £15

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett face another selection of hopeful entrepreneurs. A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a pottery wheel, a transforming tea stand and a set of port hole mirrors

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores Abergavenny food festival in Wales, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Cargo in a British port grinds to a halt when a tugboat picks up a mystery object in its propeller. The divers respond to a callout to get the tug moving again, and end up using everything at their disposal - even a kitchen knife - in an attempt to free the propeller from whatever has been dumped in the river

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the Easter fixtures, including Hull FC v Hull Kingston Rovers, Wigan Warriors v St Helens and Leeds Rhinos v Huddersfield Giants

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers visit Edinburgh, where they learn about 19th-century serial murderers William Burke and William Hare. The duo also discover dark histories in pubs that witnessed murder, crime and gruesome punishments in the 1800s, hear about a ghost who haunts one of the city's oldest bars. They also meet a pub folk singer who keeps the Scottish capital's historic tales alive in his songs

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Following the astonishing wildlife, landscapes and people of the world's longest river, the Nile, beginning in the tropical mountain range of the Rwenzoris, home to one of the world's strangest birds, the shoebill stork. Then, cameras follow the Nile's journey as it travels through the wild Savannah lands of Uganda, before reaching the Ethiopian highlands where it receives an injection of water far to the East

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team create an unusual B&B in Devon for Michele and Tobin, who want to turn their tired summerhouse into a property that could accommodate four-legged guests

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality renovations for a three-bed home in Surrey, which has a poorly positioned front door and a cluttered hallway. The owners are divided over whether an extension would solve their problems, and the architects present them with two very different visions for what their home could be. Laura takes a characteristically pragmatic approach with a simple but striking contemporary design. But experimental architect Robert decides a far more radical approach is the only answer

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the picturesque Cotswolds village of Broadway to uncover its artistic past. He also revisits some of the historic venues from the series, with new valuations and unexpected auctions

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared each Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Si King of the Hairy Bikers checks in and is keen to help in the kitchen, but Sharon first organises for him to visit the Lacada Brewery - a community-led project that has mastered the art of the perfect brew. Armed with the local, flavourful tipple, Si assists chef Alex in the kitchen creating a seafood feast to celebrate the bountiful catch from Northern Ireland's coast

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Members of the public nominate local heroes from across Yorkshire to receive a bespoke, hand-made piece of wooden furniture to recognise the work they do for their communities. Sisters Becky and Shelley, who work for a homeless charity in Leeds, receive a bespoke piece of wooden furniture, and sheep farmer David from the Yorkshire Dales nominates fellow farmer Sam, who went out of his way to help him in his hour of need

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: The hunt for a missing person in the vast rural area around Golspie sees search dog handler PC Adam Naismith and German shepherd Wolf deployed, bu the case takes a turn when police discover he is wanted for questioning by another force. Inverness CID carry out a major operation against county lines drug dealers. On Skye, Sgt Gordon McKay comes to the aid of a stranded tourist with a nasty hillwalking injury

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Gordon's day goes from bad to worse when he is distracted by the impulsive actions of an attractive stranger, Ashley, and accidentally hits a stray dog with his car. Australian comedy about two singletons who proceed to navigate the complexities of life together. Written by and starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Gods of Snooker
programme.desc: Desperate for success and tempted by the lucrative rewards brought by towing the line, Jimmy White joined Barry Hearn in the hope he could be turned into a champion like his new stablemate Steve Davis. With White as the hot favourite and with the crowd urging him on against 21-year-old Stephen Hendry, the final of 1990 world championship turned out to be a pivotal moment in British snooker and paved the way for what was to come in the next decade

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Seven well known personalities with differing faiths and beliefs, meet in northern Portugal to tackle a modern-day Catholic pilgrimage. Taking part are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight

programme.title: The MI5 Spy and the IRA: Operation Chiffon
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Peter Taylor reveals the extraordinary story of how a former undercover MI5 officer put his life and career on the line to encourage the IRA to end its violent campaign and embrace politics. The former MI5 officer, simply known as Robert, ran the top-secret back channel of communications between the UK government and the leadership of the IRA. What Robert did has been a closely guarded secret for three decades and was the key link in the chain that led to the Good Friday Agreement

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. She tries a marriage introduction day at a mosque, a Muslim-only dating app and a live dating event with a difference. Will she find love? And will her mother approve?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.desc: This week's final trek is a mountain walk through the Glen of Sligachan, but the boggy terrain is filled with midges as musician Innes and the other hikers soon discover

programme.desc: Cameras follow events at a Co Durham pet hospital. Bilko the Labrador is rushed in with an extreme allergic reaction. Hope, a Belgian Malinois, has a mystery lump in her throat, while Roxy the Dachshund has a serious case of tremors. Narrated by Kieran Bew

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave Myers delves into Bristol's seafaring past, discovering an inn with a special hole in the wall designed to keep watch for press gangs, sampling some cider and finding out about a landlord who played a key role in the abolition of slavery

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: A journey along the American river, whose fingers stretch into nearly half of the USA, collecting water from 31 states. The documentary follows the Mississippi through varied landscapes from its source to its mouth, starting in the towering Rocky Mountains of Wyoming and Montana, where billions of tons of water, ultimately destined to flow south are trapped as ice and snow

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: In Monmouthshire in South Wales, Simon Parfett and his team take on a 1980s double decker bus conversion for recycling centre worker Stacy

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: When Naomi and Yehuda bought their 1950s post-war semi in Hertfordshire, they thought they'd found the ideal home for them and their growing family. Sadly, they soon discovered that the home had little character, and while the rooms were a good size, many had no designated purpose - a particular issue was the tiny, cramped kitchen. Robert Jamison and Laura Jane Clark go head to head to try and solve this huge challenge. Can they create designs that satisfy these two very different visions? Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Glemham Hall in the Suffolk countryside. David Fletcher discovers scripts from the TV series Lovejoy, and Jonathan Pratt spots Beatles dolls

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Actor Adam Woodyatt checks in to the B&B on Northern Ireland's Causeway Coast, miles away from his previous home in Walford. Chef Alex needs Adam's help to prepare an Indian-inspired feast, but they're still missing a few key ingredients. Luckily host Sharon knows a local farm that might be able to help. Alex makes use of Adam's newfound passion for cooking, preparing a spiced goat curry with yoghurt flat breads. The next day, Adam enjoys a workout on the beach. Accompanied by some local fitness enthusiasts, he's put through his paces with a special fitness session

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Jez and Shane from Huddersfield come to the workshop to tell Jay Blades about a man known as Mr Bob. He set up a mental health charity for men in the local station called Platform 1 and has helped hundreds of men in crisis, including Shane. They'd like Jay and his team to come up with a chair for Mr Bob to say thank you. Expert woodworker Ciaran designs a contemporary wingback chair set on a pedestal. Jay also travels across Bradford to a part of the city called Manningham. Here, he meets PC Husnain, who tells Jay that, having grown up there surrounded by gangs, his life could have turned out very differently if it hadn't been for a youth worker called Sharat

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale and a team of tradespeople travel across the islands, using their craft skills, energy and creativity for a series of makeovers. In the first edition, the team transforms a family-run fish shop in Tobermory on the Isle of Mull in a commission from Banjo's friend Sally, who is the manager and wants to modernise the traditional business

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans, Mandy Watkins and Glen Thomas begin the search for the most impressive property in Wales, scoring the houses on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style. They start out in the north east region with visits to an 18th-century manor house given a colourful makeover by its owners, an 1890s Victorian terrace whose unassuming exterior hides a surprising interior and Grade II listed Beechmount House, a fairy-tale blend of mullioned glass windows, organic curves and church-like ceilings and archways

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Seventy six-year-old Barry is on the cardiac ward, waiting for a double bypass - but a shortage of beds means his operation has already been cancelled twice in two weeks. Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans is hoping it will be third time lucky today as she prepares to take him into theatre. Others hoping their operations will go ahead are 57-year-old Dawn, who is having a cancerous tumour removed from her brain, and 15-year-old Jack, who has waited more than a year to correct his curved spine

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy is living with his mother-in-law, Lance's flat is not his own any more and the dark cloud of a solar farm threatens the gang's tranquillity. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Stronger (2017)
programme.desc: A man's life changes radically after he is seriously injured in the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings. Jeff Bauman loses both his legs in the tragedy, but captures the hearts of his city and the world through his recovery, as he adjusts to his new way of life. Drama based on a true story, starring Jake Gyllenhaal

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: In the Leeds Children's Hospital, paediatric consultant Naved Alizai prepares to perform the high-risk and complex operation needed by eight-year-old Ollie, who has a blockage in the blood supply to his liver. If left untreated it could prove fatal. Also on Naved's surgery list is one-year-old Maya Mae, who was born with a large cyst growing in one of the ducts to her liver. At St James's Hospital, endocrine consultants Sheila Fraser and Emma Collins prepare to remove a tumour from the thyroid gland in an 85-year-old patient's neck

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: Radical transformations, including a disused sideboard that is turned into a special item for a family and an ornate clock of huge sentimental value. Sabrina Grant presents

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A beloved gramophone, which reminds the owner of her music-loving grandad, and an old slide projector belonging to a photography enthusiast are among the transformations

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a buyer find a new lease on life in the countryside. Now her sons have fledged the nest, today's buyer has her sights on Devon or Dorset

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Jack with some 1940 stained-glass library dividers followed by Geoff with a racing tricycle. Terri and Natalie bring a chest full of Sindy house furniture and Kevin presents the dealers with an interesting painting linked to a famous artist. Last in is Caroline with a vintage copper milking machine

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox returns with the programme that celebrates the joy of books and reading, and is joined by guests Angela Scanlon, DJ Spoony, Rob Rinder and Cerys Matthews. They all bring their favourite books to champion, and review this week's book club choices of In the Blink of an Eye by Jo Callaghan, and Burial Rites by Hannah Kent

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood highlights innovative methods used to catch criminals. A mother arrives home with her newborn baby, only for masked burglars to smash in, and a dashcam reveals a van driver's criminal behaviour before a crash

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the remaining 17 contestants to compete for a possible £10,000 jackpot. Right answers take them closer to the big money, but if at any stage they give an Impossible answer, they will immediately be knocked out. Quiz, hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Matt Baker presents the men's all-around event from Antalya, Turkey, as Europe's best male gymnasts showcase their intricate and explosive acrobatic moves in a bid to be crowned continental champion. Joe Fraser made history in Munich last summer by becoming the first British male gymnast to win the coveted title. Fresh from winning three gold medals at his hometown Commonwealth Games, the Birmingham gymnast impressed across all six apparatus, scoring top on parallel bars and pommel horse

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tara can only build temporary structures on a piece of Wiltshire land she inherited. Using a reassembled corrugated metal shed, Simon devises a plan to create a tiny off-grid eco shed that will be a unique place to stay

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are at Glemham Hall in the Suffolk countryside, where David Fletcher spots a rare flintlock pistol, and James Lewis uncovers a copy of a Raphael painting

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge skills ahead of the final on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Cerys Matthews check in and chef Alex accompanies the musician, author and radio host to a local farm, whose owners Richard and Leona have a passion for turning rapeseed flowers into delicious, flavoured oils. Cerys and Alex take some of the oils back to the B&B to enhance the evening meal. While most guests start their morning at the B&B with a challenge, host Sharon helps Cerys fulfil a lifelong wish to visit the Giant's Causeway

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Veteran Tony comes to the workshop to tell Jay about fellow veteran Paul, who suffered problems such as homelessness when he left the forces. Paul went on to set up a charity in Hull to help other former service men and women with things like housing and food. The charity plans to build the world's first veteran's village, featuring 48 homes. Tony would like Jay and his team to come up with something for Paul's office. Also visiting the workshop is Lesley. She comes to tell Jay about Edgar and Elizabeth, who fostered her when she was a teenager. Lesley says they helped turn her life around and that she and her family now feel like a part of theirs, something she wasn't expecting as a young person growing up in the care system. Edgar and Elizabeth have gone on to foster 130 children

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female group from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a much-anticipated reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: Brian Cox: Seven Days on Mars
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox fulfils a childhood dream by going behind the scenes at Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), mission control for Mars 2020 - one of the most ambitious missions ever launched, which may finally reveal if life has ever existed on the Red Planet. In 1980, a young Brian Cox wrote to JPL asking for photos from some of their missions to the planets. The pictures they sent him from Voyager and the Viking mission to Mars were a source of inspiration that set him on the path to becoming a physicist

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: The comedian returns with her travelogue in which she tracks down the world's most endangered jobs and crafts. She begins in Greece, where she meets the last monk in a monastery, a family of church bell-makers, and villagers who communicate by whistling to one another

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Seventy six-year-old Barry is on the cardiac ward, waiting for a double bypass - but a shortage of beds means his operation has already been cancelled twice in two weeks. Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans is hoping it will be third time lucky today as she prepares to take him into theatre. Others hoping their operations will go ahead are 57-year-old Dawn, who is having a cancerous tumour removed from her brain, and 15-year-old Jack, who has waited more than a year to correct his curved spine

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary about Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator examines how the actor and comedian's reputation evolved in the 1970s, when he became an on-screen educator and moral authority - a man thought to be trustworthy

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Frida and Diego travel to San Francisco where he has an important mural commission. Her style stirs much excitement, and Frida is determined to succeed in her own right in the face of Diego's affairs. Shocked by the vast gap between rich and poor that she witnesses in Depression-era New York, she struggles to hide her disdain for high society

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry arrives home to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: The documentary considers how people's understanding of nature is increasing in order to manage global warming, which is changing the planet faster than ever before

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Having restored the main farmhouse, Griff Rhys Jones embarks on the second phase of his Pembrokeshire project, turning his attention to the watermill and the derelict miller's cottage. With his son George, who is training to be an architect, overseeing the design, Griff plans to convert both these outbuildings into accommodation

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. In the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Later, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: King Philip is eager to avenge the execution of Mary, Queen of Scots, and urges an unprepared fleet to sail on England. Elizabeth pins her hopes on peace talks with Spain but Drake's actions in Cadiz force her hand. Historical drama, starring Glenda Jackson, Peter Jeffrey and John Woodvine

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The year is 1600 and Elizabeth is now an old woman yet she is still a match for the young, handsome and dashing Earl of Essex. However, problems in Ireland and crushing the rebellious Essex rob an aged and weary Queen of the will to live. Glenda Jackson and Robin Ellis star

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. In the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Later, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob follows artist Sonia Boyce as she represents Great Britain at the 2022 Venice Biennale, making her the first black woman to hold this prestigious role. Cameras follows the installation of her pavilion, which draws on the lives of black women in the British music industry. The programme looks back on her career, which has encompassed pastel self-portraits, interactive ice sculptures and performance art created through improvisation

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock presents the latest science in the hunt for exterrestrial life, visiting Professor Mark Sephton at Imperial College London - one of the scientists leading on the Perseverance Rover mission to Mars. Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969)
programme.desc: Two notorious outlaws' routine of bank and train robberies is cut short when a seemingly unstoppable posse is formed to catch them. The pair plan to flee America and start a new life in Bolivia, with the Sundance Kid's schoolmistress lover in tow - but staying ahead of the law is not so easy. Western, starring Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross

programme.title: Blazing Saddles (1974)
programme.desc: A crooked railway tycoon whose men are terrorising a frontier town arranges for a black sheriff to be appointed, hoping the racist residents will reject him. The lawman proves more cunning than expected, and with the help of a drunken gunslinger, runs rings around the businessman. Mel Brooks' Western spoof, in which he co-stars alongside Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder and Madeline Kahn

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits the north of Britain to look at the most fascinating archaeology uncovered in the region over the course of 2021. In North Yorkshire, a team of community volunteers are digging down beneath Richmond Castle. On the northern tip of the Orkney Islands, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists racing to unearth rare discoveries from an endangered Neolithic tomb before it erodes into the sea. And 10 miles east of Edinburgh, volunteers are hunting for evidence of Scotland's oldest railway

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer prepares for a date by dusting off his prized hairpiece, but Shaun loses it while showing off to the flock and enlists Bitzer's aid to find it before the big night

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM faces his toughest challenge ever, as a mysterious super-villain releases all the outlaws from Arkwright and plots the hero's end

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: JJ is convinced that Mrs Creecher is secretly a master of Blamjitsu, so she ersuades the gang to help trick her into revealing her blam credentials

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mum and the girls have an annual day where they do a bunch of fun stuff together. However, this year, Mum invites the boys and Dad to join them too

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: After the battery dies on her laser shoe, special agent Gloria Hope calls on the Ninjas to help her find a new one and foil criminal mastermind Pam D'Terre.

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: It's Danny and Mick's first day at the new leisure centre, and they are surprised to be greeted by their old boss Joy. She wastes no time in making sure they stay out of trouble by getting them to dust the sports hall ceiling. How can such a simple task go so wrong!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Olive and Otto get trapped inside a board game

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Celebi accidentally takes Ash and Torracat back into the past, where they discover a very special object.

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Ash and Torracat return from the past to find that things have changed dramatically while they were away.

programme.title: Oswaldo
programme.desc: Oswaldo searches for the mealsicle he once bought from a beach vendor.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: Three monster-loving kids visit their grandfather in the most haunted city on earth.

programme.desc: In the final episode, Steve looks back at his top Deadly Predators from the series and meets the ultimate predator. He reviews the biggest and best stunts from the series and reveals how the team bought a giant air vortex cannon to the Deadly junkyard to demonstrate the predatory prowess of the sperm whale

programme.desc: A Celtic farmer is not keen on plans for Hadrian's Wall, the identity of Britain's top-scoring footballer is revealed, and pioneers of transport sing about their inventions

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Anthony is suspicious of Jude's new-found choreography genius, and Richelle believes Ozzy's new girlfriend has an ulterior motive

programme.desc: Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers as they attempt to win the regional championships

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese

Mouse is the judge and decides how to settle family arguments, putting wrongdoers into a homemade jail. However, when Mouse also behaves badly, he puts himself in jail and the whole family realises it is locked in

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The gang enters Pieface into a comedy contest to make him realise how brilliantly funny he is

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Walter's pampered cat Clawdia persuades her way into the gang, and only Gnasher can tell that she has a hidden agenda to oust him from Dennis's life for ever

programme.title: Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: When Harry and Dillon discover that it was Mike who ended Hansard's career with a horror tackle, they do everything they can to wind Jamie up during the cup match. There's a Hawkstone scout watching the match - will Jamie be able to keep his hot temper in check, or will Dillon get the nod ahead of him?

programme.title: Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: It's Dillon's first try out at Hawkstone Academy and Jack is sent along to cover it for the school blog. Jack can't stand seeing Dillon taking Jamie's place and sets out to try and persuade the Hawkstone manager to give Jamie a try. Dillon does well but is bullied by Hawkstone's star player Jethro. Meanwhile Jamie struggles to come to terms with the consequences of his actions and it's only when Mike gives him his beloved Book of Legends that Jamie finds the final piece of advice he needs - from football legend Ian Wright

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Kelvin Fletcher joins the team in the garden and Mwaksy meets viewers who love gardening with their grandparents

programme.desc: Sally falls ill and Darrell has to play in her place in an important lacrosse match,and discovers Malory Towers are playing her old school, forcing her to face her past

programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Jack with some 1940 stained-glass library dividers followed by Geoff with a racing tricycle. Terri and Natalie bring a chest full of Sindy house furniture and Kevin presents the dealers with an interesting painting linked to a famous artist. Last in is Caroline with a vintage copper milking machine

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble arises for Eve and Suki when Nish starts asking questions and things get worse for Stacey when a huge electricity bill arrives. Sam receives an offer she can't refuse but it means leaving Ricky behind all over again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How the discovery of a car buried deep within a scrapper's yard proved the key to unlocking the riddle of who was responsible for a suspected gangland shooting at a secluded location. Plus, how tracking a car wash owner's phone connected him to modern-day slavery. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: One of the park's favourite couples, armadillos Preston and Polly, are due to be reunited to have another litter. However the keepers make a worrying discovery - Polly is bleeding and they need to figure out what's making her sick. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to Stockport, Greater Manchester, to see a two-bed mid-terrace with a considerable damp problem. Martin Roberts is just outside Stoke-on-Trent, where even getting over the threshold of a two-bed mid-terrace is ill-advised. The programme also revisits Milton in Staffordshire, where in 2021 Dion Dublin saw a mixed residential and commercial auction lot

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian go antique hunting with two teams at the Royal Cheshire Showground, while presenter Eric Knowles heads to Knutsford's penny farthing museum

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A mother of a young toddler calls on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to breath some life and vibrancy into a dull dining space. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton guides a pair of budding entrepreneurs who want to escape to the Cotswolds. They have a generous £900,000 to play with, but the property must have the potential to develop a boutique country holiday let. Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Stunt man David turns up with the 1976 toy that inspired his career. His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for £15

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Drastic times call for drastic measures for Stacey as the bills pile high, and Nish quizzes Suki about her time with Eve in Leeds. Amy is in trouble at home when she is caught trying to steal booze from Peggy's

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female band from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Belfast's fastest growing beauty brand, where the motto is 'work hard, play hard'. The team prepare for a collaboration with Love Island winner Ekin-Su. Product designer Alex is feeling the pressure as she has to create a whole new palette and foundation range that Ekin-Su has to love. Everyone in the office is talking about Emma's new boyfriend but she's keeping him to herself for now and staying busy organising promotions on Ireland's most watched chat show

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Brendan has finally been able to fulfil a lifelong dream - to open his own make-up store in Ibiza. Social media whizz Ciara, is flying back from a launch in Toronto for a photoshoot with actress Jac Jossa on the island but things go south when Jac is in a car crash. Four hours before opening, the store is a mess and it's all hands on deck to prepare

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: A journalist offers Costello an exciting opportunity while she works at the peep show and she throws herself into the challenge while trying to keep her and Iris afloat. Gloria forms an unlikely connection at work, derailing her good behaviour and Selby reconnects with some old friends

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and Jake organise the biggest gender reveal party the north-east has ever seen but nerves set in as Charlotte is behind schedule leaving Jake alone to entertain the guests. As Letitia's shock diagnosis starts to sink in, Charlotte and her mum have an emotional heart to heart

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and her mum argue as they get to grips with the diagnosis but all is forgiven when they go wig shopping in London after Letitia's first treatment. At Crosby Manor, the builders are in to start planning the new nursery and Charlotte faces the fact her mum might not be at the birth

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: An ice pick found on the roof of a pub brings a murderer to justice and an anonymous letter informs police of a man who is storing and making guns

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers try a new strategy to get the koalas mating, pairing up two couples into separate enclosures. But aggression soon threatens the breeding programme

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A pretty cottage in New Mills in Powys, a bungalow in Bilston in the West Midlands, and an end-terrace with holiday-let potential in Norfolk's Great Yarmouth are sold at auction. The developers have set budgets, but have to re-evaluate when faced with soaring building material costs

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp is joined by two teams led by experts Charles Hanson and David Harper at an antiques fair in Newbury, Berkshire. The presenter also has a chat with Tim Weeks about the collectable toy market

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the double booking nightmare that put a real dampener on the holidays of two families. Plus, the driver whose whose car was left damaged by an airport meet-and-greet service

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Perthshire call on the help of interior designer Russell Sage for advice on how to inject some life into their blank canvas of a living room

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer with a budget of £260,000 to escape her small flat near Heathrow for some much needed peace and quiet in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Jack with some 1940 stained-glass library dividers followed by Geoff with a racing tricycle. Terri and Natalie bring a chest full of Sindy house furniture and Kevin presents the dealers with an interesting painting linked to a famous artist. Last in is Caroline with a vintage copper milking machine

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble arises for Eve and Suki when Nish starts asking questions and things get worse for Stacey when a huge electricity bill arrives. Sam receives an offer she can't refuse but it means leaving Ricky behind all over again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers and guests discuss President Biden's recent visit to Northern Ireland for the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: The crew look forward to a fresh start in the new year but the upcoming debutante ball threatens some already fragile bonds. Julien settles into life at Nick and Zoya's and Monet comes up with a plan to ruin things

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Things get complicated when Gideon agrees to hold a dinner party to impress Roy's client and Zoya starts to spend more time with Shan's family. Obie returns to Constance Billiard after avoiding his friends over the winter break and Monet attempts to install a social hierarchy at school.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: How the discovery of a car buried deep within a scrapper's yard proved the key to unlocking the riddle of who was responsible for a suspected gangland shooting at a secluded location. Plus, how tracking a car wash owner's phone connected him to modern-day slavery. Narrated by Chuku Modu

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: One of the park's favourite couples, armadillos Preston and Polly, are due to be reunited to have another litter. However the keepers make a worrying discovery - Polly is bleeding and they need to figure out what's making her sick. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to Stockport, Greater Manchester, to see a two-bed mid-terrace with a considerable damp problem. Martin Roberts is just outside Stoke-on-Trent, where even getting over the threshold of a two-bed mid-terrace is ill-advised. The programme also revisits Milton in Staffordshire, where in 2021 Dion Dublin saw a mixed residential and commercial auction lot

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian go antique hunting with two teams at the Royal Cheshire Showground, while presenter Eric Knowles heads to Knutsford's penny farthing museum

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A mother of a young toddler calls on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to breath some life and vibrancy into a dull dining space. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton guides a pair of budding entrepreneurs who want to escape to the Cotswolds. They have a generous £900,000 to play with, but the property must have the potential to develop a boutique country holiday let. Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Stunt man David turns up with the 1976 toy that inspired his career. His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for £15

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Drastic times call for drastic measures for Stacey as the bills pile high, and Nish quizzes Suki about her time with Eve in Leeds. Amy is in trouble at home when she is caught trying to steal booze from Peggy's

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett face another selection of hopeful entrepreneurs. A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Agreement
programme.desc: Miriam O'Callaghan presents a documentary marking the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, examining the intense negotiations that led to the North's comprehensive political settlement in April 1998. The documentary also looks at the unprecedented referendum campaign when voters in Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland gave their verdict on the Agreement. With contributions from key figures including Tony Blair, Bertie Ahern and George Mitchell

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: After a little nap, AH-AH finds himself stuck in his chair. He asks for help from his friends but, unfortunately, they don't think it's a big problem at all

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: Linda visits Meaban and Moo at their hut to set them a number of fun challenges

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo
programme.desc: Huggleboo asks her mum for a dog

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Ernest is honoured when the mayor asks him to sing the Song of the Bears - but when his voice starts acting up, who can replace him if they're not a large bear with a rough voice?

programme.title: Shane an Chef
programme.desc: Shanes want to find hazelnuts for his dish of the day so he, Izzy and Mario head to the woods to forage for some

programme.title: 'S E Iasg a Th'Annam (I'm a Fish)
programme.desc: The pineapple fish tells us how they are shy, how they glow in the dark to attract their prey and also to communicate with other pineapple fish

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Catriona Mackinnon reads Iongantas Handa, written and illustrated by Eileen Browne and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds don’t care about their carbon footprint, especially since George has come home with a haul of free electrics that they all want to test out

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: The magic is erupting from them today

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Mika is very worried about the forest and he want to save it
An insight into Rachel Allan’s life at 12 years old

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Things are quite sticky today and Coinneach Clogaid learns that balloons aren’t the only things that are full of air

programme.title: Proiseact Ploigh
programme.desc: Dr Moiteil and Professor Olive have fun with science in the company of the Lasgainean

programme.title: An Là (News)

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief
