programme.desc: Cora's playboy brother Harold has got himself into a spot of bother and Robert has to make a trip to America to bail him out. Blake and Mary are forced to put aside their differences to deal with the new farming venture on the estate, and help comes from an unlikely quarter when Violet is taken ill. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes, Mrs Patmore and Carson try to keep the peace when romantic tensions cause disagreements downstairs. Hugh Bonneville, Julian Ovenden, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith star in the costume drama

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A witchcraft scare sweeps through Aidensfield, but Greengrass, who clearly subscribes to the old adage that where there's muck there's money, is too preoccupied with a new get-rich-quick scheme to care _ he is convinced the hidden properties of local mud are about to make him a fortune. Bill Maynard stars as the rascally rustic

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of a young man is found in a Second World War-era motor car full of exhaust fumes, it looks like an obvious case of suicide. But Simon Bright was not alone - and he was hit on the head before he died. Where is his girlfriend, newcomer Laura Sharp? And what is her hold on the people of Morton Fendle, a village still overshadowed by the gloomy spectre of the war? John Nettles and Jason Hughes star

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine finds herself coming into conflict with her daughter Ellie when she investigates the murder of charismatic singer Jack Taylor, who has been found dead at his apartment. She soon learns that the vocalist had difficult relationships with those close to him, and his girlfriend Amy (former Coronation Street actor Tina O'Brien) becomes a suspect. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When a woman is found strangled, a pathologist detects chilling similarities with a number of unsolved murders - prompting Wycliffe and his team to reopen 11-year-old case files. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Tim Wylton and Helen Masters

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Skelthwaite struggles to adjust to the loss of Sally Boothe, as husband Billy vows revenge for a rugby team's prank rather than face the reality of his wife's death. Anna and Kim welcome the latest recruit, excitable trainee Zoe Phelps, while the hospital staff attempt to make a young heart transplant patient's wish come true. Lesley Dunlop and Denise Van Outen star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly guest stars as factory worker Barry, whose shocking secret is revealed when Zoe goes to give a healthy eating talk at his firm. The trainee nurse also finds romance with a sexy stranger, while Harding is concerned about the arrival of an old rival in Skelthwaite. The rugby pitch gets waterlogged - so Billy persuades his team-mates to try cookery classes. Drama, with Andrea Lowe

programme.desc: Rosamund comes up with a plan to help Edith out of her predicament, but will Violet see straight through it? programme.desc: A professor feels humiliated when her internet dating video is leaked onto a website and watched by her students. However, Lewis is not convinced and digs deeper, identifying several suspects including the site's founder - but as he and Hathaway get closer to the truth amid a rising death toll, they find their personal and professional lives dredged up online for all to see. programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars

programme.desc: It's summer and as part of Rose's debutante 'coming out' she is to be presented at Buckingham Palace. The family is in London, preparing Grantham House for the busy social programme, and Martha Levinson, not one to miss such a grand occasion, arrives from New York with Cora's recently disgraced brother Harold (Sideways star Paul Giamatti). Both outspoken and larger than life, they make quite an impression on certain members of high society. Meanwhile, when the Crawleys are implicated in a scandal that threatens to engulf the monarchy, Robert goes to great lengths to protect the royal family - and his own. Costume drama, starring Lily James, Shirley MacLaine, Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Laura Carmichael and Elizabeth McGovern

But Luke lived a simple life and had even severed all ties to the quaint rural village where he grew up - including his mother Carmel. Can she shed any light on her son's murder?

Nick and Stefan are forced to comply with the house rules in some alternative attire, while Tony and Natalie make some dirty discoveries in their dog-friendly room. At dinner, the hosts serve up their spiritual side, and the competition hots up as Stefan reveals his hospitality pedigree. In the morning, a mushroom misdemeanour leaves a bad taste in Tony's mouth

programme.title: Four in a Bed

The homely styled bedrooms aren't to everyone's taste, and at dinner there's a debate about how to host. At breakfast, some guests pick holes in the pre-order system, and in the kitchen Ewa's under pressure

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Fox Inn in Stourton, Staffordshire, owned by uncle and nephew Stefan Carron and Nick Edwards. Most of their guests are bowled over by the bedrooms, but Tony isn't wild about the decor. At dinner, Stefan impresses with some serious celebrity name dropping and Tony reveals his alternative approach to taking on staff. At breakfast, pro chef Nick pulls out all the stops with his presentation, but missing items mean feedback falls short from Tony

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The New Inn in Newton, Derbyshire, owned by Tony Carlin, who's joined by his partner Natalie Briggs. On first impressions the guests feel it's lacking luxury, and Ewa and Ellie have cleanliness concerns. At dinner, the luxury label is called into question, and a bust up over the self-service breakfast is narrowly avoided. At breakfast time, the hosts do a disappearing act, which doesn't go down well with their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Just B is first, and owners Karen and Geoff get some answers while hearing the truth from guests on their hair-raising stay

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets south London chef Corinne, who loves to entertain and is rustling up plans for a beautifully crafted, double-kitchen home designed around her love of cooking. The end-of-terrace plot is on a hill and surrounded by woodland within a strict conservation area, so it won't be an easy build. But having come through a divorce and cancer treatment, Corinne sees the house as vital on so many levels, not least as an opportunity to create a space that represents her new lease of life

programme.title: Rise and Fall
programme.desc: Greg joins the Rulers in the Red Room for the semi-final to oversee a stomach-churning Work Shift, but who will be heading into the final as Rulers?

Sergeant Andy makes an impromptu stop that leads to a drug bust and PC Jess detains someone for an assault in a strip club

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. The chef tries to teach her the basics of cooking and venue management, but trouble brews when her staff threaten to walk out on relaunch night

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Tempting Fortune

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

However, criticism of their unusual menu causes Andrew to bite back, and things don't improve when he does his Mr Bean impressions. On the last night, food connoisseurs Rob and Emma plan a fine dining menu, but suffer a few unfortunate mishaps in the kitchen. programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team tracks down fascinating facts from around the world related to the growing British tradition of savouring takeaway food, on which a billion pounds is spent a month. Jimmy Doherty is in Thailand to discover the unexpected addition in spring rolls. He then heads to India to find out the real reason takeaway curry can be so delicious - the mythical ingredient, ghee. Amanda Byram spills the beans on coffee and learns why some cups leave consumers more 'buzzing' than others. Andi Oliver has the meaty task of learning how doner kebabs are made and bags herself an invite to the fancy award ceremony known as the Kebaftas

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team take on their first prehistoric dig as they try to unearth ancient roundhouses in the village of Stretton in Staffordshire. programme.desc: Documentary examining the mysterious disappearance of financial advisor Lynda Spence, who vanished without a trace in 2011 from her hometown of Glasgow. As the police launched their investigation, they began to uncover hidden multiple identities, links to suspected gangsters and property fraud which stretched from Glasgow to London. What followed was one of the longest murder trials in Scotland's history, but without a body, the case remained unsolved. Fast forward to April 2022 and police have reopened the search for Lynda, but will they finally find out what happened to her?

programme.desc: Every 90 seconds someone is reported missing in the UK. Most are found within hours, many are located in a matter of days but there are some who seem to disappear, often with little or no trace. Dan Walker investigates more cases of people who have gone missing - some well known, others not, and each with a unique set of circumstances. Dan speaks directly to loved ones, families, friends, police and experts from charities

programme.desc: An investigation into the case of doorman and car clamper Levi Bellfield, who committed three murders - including that of schoolgirl Milly Dowler in 2002. But would he have gone on to claim even more victims had he not made a string of mistakes that alerted police? Cameras follow their progress as the duo adapt to life in Africa

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild (2003)
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry

programme.title: Shrek the Third (2007)
programme.desc: The bad-tempered ogre finds himself in the unwelcome position of being next in line for the throne. Preferring to stay at home in the swamps, he sets out on a quest to find the rightful heir - a rebellious teenager named Artie - and persuade him to face up to his responsibilities as the future king. Meanwhile, the ambitious Prince Charming sees his chance to take the throne. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Masters of the Universe (1987)
programme.desc: The heroic warrior He-Man sets out to bring an end to the evil Skeletor's reign of terror, but is transported to Earth by a cosmic key, with his arch enemy's henchman in hot pursuit. Fantasy adventure, starring Dolph Lundgren, Frank Langella, Meg Foster and Billy Barty

programme.title: Mysterious Island (1961)
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Galaxy Quest (1999)
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Jack Reacher (2012)
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back (2016)
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: The Guilty (2018)
programme.desc: Asger, a frustrated and troubled cop, is mired in a mysterious workplace controversy and has been confined to the emergency response help lines while the issue is resolved. He gets a confusing call from a woman named Iben, who appears to be in immediate danger after being abducted by her partner. Asger tries to piece together where she is and how to get help to her. Writer/director Gustav Moller's crime drama, starring Jakob Cedergren. In Danish with English subtitles

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins (2011)
programme.desc: A workaholic businessman always puts his job before his family until he receives an unexpected inheritance from his explorer father - six penguins. He abandons his plan to offload the birds to a zoo when he finds his kids love them, and sets about turning his New York apartment into a suitable habitat. Family comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Carla Gugino and Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Monster Trucks (2016)
programme.desc: A drilling operation unleashes a subterranean creature which feeds on oil. The monster bonds with a monster truck which a local teenager is building from spare parts, and the youngster befriends the beast and helps it to return to its underground home. Fantasy adventure, starring Lucas Till and Jane Levy

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Carry On Cabby (1963)
programme.desc: The neglected wife of a workaholic taxi owner grows increasingly tired of his lack of interest in their marriage. In a ploy to bring him to his senses, she secretly launches a rival cab firm with a driver roster made up of attractive women, who soon tempt his customers away. Comedy, starring Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Kenneth Connor and Charles Hawtrey

programme.title: Hidden Figures (2016)
programme.desc: As the space race reaches fever pitch in the early 1960s, a trio of female African-American mathematicians attempt to overcome prejudice and find work with NASA. Their remarkable skills prove vital in getting an astronaut into orbit and bringing him safely back to Earth, but to realise their potential they must overcome deep-seated prejudice in the space programme and society as a whole. Fact-based drama, starring Taraji P Henson, Octavia Spencer, Janelle Monae and Kevin Costner

programme.title: Patriot Games (1992)
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead man's revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancy's novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger (1994)
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancy's novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse (2015)
programme.desc: Three teenage scouts look forward to spending their last camping trip together. However, they soon have a more pressing need for their wilderness survival skills when their home town is overrun with the walking dead. Fortunately, a tough cocktail waitress is on hand to help the youngsters survive the zombie onslaught. Comedy horror, starring Tye Sheridan, Logan Miller and Joey Morgan

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure (2005)
programme.desc: Two squabbling brothers with time on their hands decide to play a mysterious old board game after finding it in their basement. A chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth (1959)
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker

programme.title: Deep Impact (1998)
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: A Knight's Tale (2001)
programme.desc: A poverty-stricken squire spies an opportunity to make his dreams come true when his employer dies. He takes his place as a knight, launching himself on the road to riches by competing in jousting tournaments, but his ruse is jeopardised by a dastardly nobleman. Comedy adventure, starring Heath Ledger, Paul Bettany, Mark Addy, Shannyn Sossamon and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: The Burnt Orange Heresy (2019)
programme.desc: Hired to steal a rare painting from one of the most enigmatic artists of all time, an ambitious dealer becomes consumed by his own greed and insecurity as the operation spins out of control. Action thriller, starring Claes Bang, Elizabeth Debicki, Mick Jagger and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit (2014)
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: Dredd (2012)
programme.desc: An uncompromising law enforcer in a post-apocalyptic city is assigned to train a psychic new recruit. A report of three murders leads them to a tower block dominated by a ruthless drug lord, only for the gangster to seal off the building, forcing them to fight their way out. Sci-fi thriller based on the 2000AD comic-strip, starring Karl Urban, Lena Headey and Olivia Thirlby

programme.desc: Peralta, Boyle and Gina get involved in a Die Hard-type hostage situation while doing some off-duty shopping on Christmas Eve, so Jeffords is forced to leave his family celebration to try to save his squad. programme.desc: Howard's fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. Meanwhile, Kripke plays a prank during a radio interview with Sheldon, who sets out to get revenge, only to be caught by the Dean. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with an appearance by Katee Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) as herself

Rick converts the garage into his laboratory and involves easily influenced grandson Morty in his insane misadventures, starting with a mission to another dimension to find the seeds to mega-trees

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole calls in a locksmith to bring a safe back from the scrapheap, and a ship's wheel is left in splinters when the presenter falls out with restorer Guy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo travel the length of Britain seeking items to fix up, flog on and sell for profit. Max upcycles a brass propeller into a stylish table lamp, while Henry goes all Victorian with an old pond yacht

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers investigate the case of Victor Evans from Bedford who died at the age of 88, but the common surname proves a real headache for them. A Victorian school in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, produces a massive windfall and an unusual challenge for the team

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and Shirley Boyle, owners of the Old Hall Country House in Madeley, Cheshire, host the week's first round of the B&B competition. The guests are impressed by the 16th-century building, and are taken tap-dancing and to a private fine-dining restaurant, but one of them is dissatisfied with her bedroom's layout and the garnish on her eggs at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are the third hosts, at their three-bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, Cornwall. For the activity they arrange a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. Some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room but the food is a success, and Eileen Finn demonstrates her karate skills on the men

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Cavendish in Bournemouth, run by Tim and Karen Sturgess. On arrival, the competitors are impressed by the 'pink palace', but things go downhill when a bed is broken and one couple are allocated a room next to the front door. However, Eileen is delighted by the feline memorabilia in her room and the group enjoys a spot of indoor paint-balling and an open-top bus tour of the resort

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is surprised by an overpayment and Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley receives tough criticism, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple of doctors in need of a property re-think. Their three-bedroom Victorian semi in Newcastle is not working for them and their two young daughters. Kathleen loves the location and reckons the house could be made to work, but Tom wants to sell up and pursue a better life in the country.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Belinda travels to Dick and Angel's chateau so that Angel can teach her the art of decoupage on a classic 1950s family dressing table. It's changeover day at Krys and Tim's chateau, as they sweat it out in 42-degree heat to get their 20-room chateau ready for their next booking. Budding chateau owners Elaine and David visit a 19th-century chateau with 18 rooms and two gîtes in Normandy

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Aaron, 31, is rushed to St George's after overturning his car onto metal railings during a high-speed collision. He has a serious laceration to his face where a spiked railing narrowly missed his eye socket. Cameras also follow Fiona, 65, who is rushed to the hospital after falling over in a restaurant and cutting her knee during her friend Evelyn's 70th birthday party

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: After multiple heart-breaking miscarriages, Jenny is in the Rotunda hoping for a good outcome with this pregnancy. Also in the hospital, it was 'love at first swipe' for young couple Michaela and Mark, who are taking a step into the unknown as they become parents for the first time. Elsewhere, Bulgarian couple Rose and Slavi arrive from Kildare just in time for the speedy arrival of their baby girl, while Joyce discovers she is about to become a mother to triplets

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is high on drugs and has been found by police sitting in a doorway with a badly broken arm. A first day at work ends badly for a member of security staff at a nightclub, as he moves awkwardly and dislocates his knee. A man who's on blood thinners falls off his mobility scooter and hits his head. With the risk of a bleed on the brain, he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A freak car accident in Cumbria leaves Richard fighting for his life. In Hampshire, horse rider Pat takes a nasty fall when her animal is spooked. Plus, in a night mission in Suffolk, the medics race to the aid of motorcyclist Nigel who has suffered serious multiple injuries

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade take on Jon Richardson and Jessica Knappett. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join wordsmith Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while maths whizz Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Aaron, 31, is rushed to St George's after overturning his car onto metal railings during a high-speed collision. He has a serious laceration to his face where a spiked railing narrowly missed his eye socket. Cameras also follow Fiona, 65, who is rushed to the hospital after falling over in a restaurant and cutting her knee during her friend Evelyn's 70th birthday party

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty dons a beer jacket in Iceland to find out if booze can keep a person warm and Kate Quilton visits New Zealand to find out how imported lamb can be sold as 'fresh'

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits Manhattan, where she creates candy canes and lollipops at artisan sugar crafter Papabubble, before heading back to the UK to learn how to make passion fruit marshmallows covered in chocolate and coconut

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Andrea and Stephen Vincent want to start the next phase of their married life with not one but two new homes, hoping to find a house in Bristol and a second property in Spain

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A hairdresser has grand plans to expand in the Costa Blanca, and a couple's dream of a new life in France running a yoga retreat falls at the first hurdle

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain looking for items to fix up and flog on behalf of their owners. In this episode they're close to the Malvern Hills. Henry picks two saddles from horse owner Sabrina and converts them into bar stools, while Simon makes a handsome profit on a 1960s kitchen cupboard

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Leeds and Preston in search of people's junk and clutter to upchucked into valuable new items. Henry makes an international set of clocks out of dashboard time pieces, while Simon builds an eccentric chandelier from car headlights

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives uncover a family history that crosses continents from Dundee to Calcutta in India when they look for heirs to the estate of May Valentine. The investigators also try to find relatives of David Smee, who died aged 57 in Stevenage, Hertfordshire, and discover he had retreated from the world

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mark and Kathy Domaille, owners of Godshill Park Farm on the Isle of Wight, host the week's first round of the B&B competition and invite their guests to take part in clay pigeon shooting. However, dust behind bath taps, a lack of coat-hangers and a breakfast that does not meet expectations take the shine off their stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Teresa and Clive, owners of the Butterfly Guest House in Porthcawl, south Wales, host the next round of the competition, but their status as beginners is confirmed when one couple find hairs in the bathroom. Another pair are shocked to discover there is no view of the sea from their window, but things liven up when the guests go bowling and attend a surprise karaoke party

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Kalpana and Joseph's four-star townhouse in Blackpool, the Address. Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike are unhappy their room overlooks a car park and security light, and a trip to the Pleasure Beach results in Teresa calling Mark and Kathy a miserable couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors head to Cumbria to visit Mike and Ruth's four-star gold-rated Crake Trees Manor. Two of the guests are looking forward to their stay in the plush building, until they discover they have been allocated outdoor accommodation without electricity, water or a toilet

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Mark and Kathy of Godshill Park Farm receive some underpayments, and accusations of game-playing abound before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Charles family in Birmingham, who are split as to whether they should sell their house, which has a loft that does not meet building regulations, an out-of-date kitchen and cracks in the walls. Phil goes house-hunting in the city's swankiest postcode and Kirstie shops for some paint, leaving Carla and Richard to decide whether to sell up or renovate

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet James and Graham, who are unable to agree about their 17th-century cottage in the Surrey village of Cranleigh. They need more space and while Graham thinks the answer to their problem would be to sell, James fancies an extension. Kirstie has an economical plan to redesign the house, while Phil finds out what £650,000 gets you in Britain's most expensive county

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick and Angel invite Tim and Krys over to their place as Dick shows Tim how to put on a gourmet weekend, and Angel has a heart-to-heart chat about chateau-living with Krys. Lee wrestles with a curtain in the shower room on arrival day for his and Belinda's first paying guests. Plus, Angela and Steve invite eight friends over to test-run their tandem holiday business

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets Mike and Sarah, who bought a remote smallholding in the Derbyshire Dales, somewhere to rear animals and provide a home for themselves and their elderly parents. Kevin follows the couple as they set out to build a 21st-century version of a historic Derbyshire longhouse. Enormous, corrugated and with a highly complex roof shape, it was never going to be an easy build. But soon they face delays and their schedule begins to slide. However, that is nothing compared with the problems of a more personal nature that hit the project

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt travels across the Atlantic to experience rural USA. Starting in Florida, he visits a cattle farmer with a passion for keeping traditions alive by hand cutting sugar cane to boil into syrup, using vintage machinery and discovering the tradition of cowboy poetry. He then travels to the Florida Keys at the southern tip of the state and heads out to help with the largest coral reef restoration effort in the world before exploring the everglades

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Dave Brecknock of Bedfordshire CID investigates a burglary at a country estate in which antiques worth £250,000 have been reported stolen. The man reporting the crime is an orthopaedic surgeon who seems very anxious to make an insurance claim on the stolen property, but the detective senses something about the case doesn't quite add up

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients include 84-year-old Neil who has fallen down the stairs at home, and his wife Jenny reflects on the shock of realising that their life may never be the same again. Orthopaedic registrar Sadia is concerned about a serious leg fracture to 25-year-old Danny, who was knocked off his motorbike, and may have other hidden internal injuries

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt travels across the Atlantic to experience rural USA. Starting in Florida, he visits a cattle farmer with a passion for keeping traditions alive by hand cutting sugar cane to boil into syrup, using vintage machinery and discovering the tradition of cowboy poetry. He then travels to the Florida Keys at the southern tip of the state and heads out to help with the largest coral reef restoration effort in the world before exploring the everglades

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: A compilation of the best bits from recent series with host Jimmy Carr, team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson, and Countdown regulars Susie Dent and Rachel Riley, joined by a host of top comedians including Alan Carr, Richard Ayoade, Roisin Conaty, Aisling Bea, Nick Mohammed, Joe Wilkinson, Sara Pascoe, Kevin Bridges and Joe Lycett

programme.desc: Patients include 84-year-old Neil who has fallen down the stairs at home, and his wife Jenny reflects on the shock of realising that their life may never be the same again. Orthopaedic registrar Sadia is concerned about a serious leg fracture to 25-year-old Danny, who was knocked off his motorbike, and may have other hidden internal injuries

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty discovers something unexpected in fish fingers and Helen Lawal investigates how safe the bacon in our butties is

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Having suffered a close bereavement and realising life is increasingly short, Jo Tweddle and her husband Rich have decided to seize the day and move to somewhere new together. Rich wants to head to north Wales, an area which he loves, while Jo would prefer to move to the hills around the beautiful city of Granada in southern Spain. Jonnie Irwin pulls out all the stops to keep them in beautiful Snowdonia with a budget of £300,000, while Laura Hamilton does everything she can to persuade Rich to buy in Granada with three stunning properties for up to £400,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two Brits struggle to turn a leaky barn into a yoga retreat in France, ex-pats welcome their first B&B guests and a couple open a restaurant in a remote Spanish village

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Cheshire and Wirral, where items include a 1920s dancehall lighting system, an antique butter churn and an old enamel advertising sign

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole is rather taken with a throne salvaged from an exotic nightclub and Simon O'Brien's restoration of a Victorian doll's house fails to go to plan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives look for the heirs to a £200,000 estate, but it proves a tough case to crack, involving extensive research into the census. They also investigate the case of a North Yorkshire man whose father was among those evacuated from Dunkirk in 1940

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another quartet of B&B owners battle it out to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money, beginning with Paul Billington and Flora Loizou from Silverwood Lodge in Cambridgeshire. The couple get a frosty response when one guest learns her hosts do not live on-site, while another is left in hysterics by an unexpected discovery

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group sets off for Great Yarmouth to stay in Sue Dodd's dog-friendly Seashells Guesthouse. Spirits run high with a trip to the beach and a game of bingo, but Nancy's complaints over dog hairs on the sheets and smoking in the rooms bring down the light-hearted mood during dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: American ex-banker Nancy Hampson hosts at the Old Court Guesthouse in Bath, but her vocal criticisms of the week's first two establishments have made her no friends among her fellow competitors. Paul Billington is annoyed that the bed he and wife Flora Loizou are given is not big enough, but is more impressed when taken for food at a quirky local restaurant

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay with Caroline Scott, the owner of the Dean B&B near Longniddry, East Lothian The picturesque house and breathtaking views across the Firth of Forth win everyone over, but underwear in the drawers, cobwebs on the curtains and a messy breakfast service seriously hamper the host's chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Sue from Seashells in Great Yarmouth confronts Nancy Hampson about the controversial topic of smoking in bedrooms, while Paul Billington and Flora Loizou are held to account about their low mark for the Old Court Guesthouse

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Alcorn family in Peebles in the Scottish Borders. The family of four lives in a conservation area and while dad Dave loves their grey-stone Victorian villa for its picture-book charm, mum Amy despises its lack of practicality. With no off-road parking, no third bedroom and no downstairs bathroom - not to mention the small, draughty kitchen - she has quite a list. Would it be best to simply move on to one of the new properties picked out by Phil, or can Kirstie come up with a way of making their home work?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp try to help a couple living in a flat on the River Thames in central London, who disagree on whether they should move. Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge helps Lincolnshire couple Tim and Rebecca find their feet after leaving the UK to start a new life in a dilapidated 25-room chateau. With no plumbing in place, they start major building works to open as a B&B in four months' time. Edward and Anna expect 185 guests in their fairy-tale chateau, but things don't go to plan when the surrounding roads get closed for the weekend. DIY enthusiast Fiona continues to single-handedly restore her magnificent 12th-century French castle into a high-end B&B, but may have met her match when she's faced with stripping 1970s carpet off the entire first floor

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Zimbabwean-born Davi and Matt from Australia, who are determined to create a home to reflect their backgrounds, so set out to build a house in the Chess Valley with a radical multicultural design, which is especially daring for their commuter-belt suburb. Despite their inexperience and the technical difficulty of the steeply sloping site, Davi and Matt manage the venture themselves. But it's not long before the problems begin

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: The work of Animal Welfare League NSW, where people come in search of a canine soulmate. Johnny and Eva want to surprise their teenager Jude with a rescue but cannot agree on the breed. And a family arrive with their cavalier Sophie, hoping to adopt her a companion. Will she connect with Martin, a timid Maltese cross?

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22 per cent and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Niki, 34, is airlifted to St George's after crashing into another rider during a charity bike ride between London and Brighton. While staff try to contact Niki's wife Phill, who is almost 300 miles away at their home in the north east of England, 90-year-old Peter is rushed to A&E with severe blood poisoning

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: Rick's tour brings him to Perigord, which is famous for its black truffles and walnuts, as well as duck dishes. He pays a visit to his favourite market in the city of Perigueux, and traces the historic connections between England and the city, which was once known as the Kingdom of Aquitaine. Inspired by his visit, he returns to the kitchen to prepare Enchaud, a traditional pot roast pork from the region, before heading towards the shores of the Mediterranean and the Cote Catalan near the Spanish border

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.desc: Rick's journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the area's famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the region's famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

programme.title: My First Threesome
programme.desc: A recent study found that 95 per cent of men and 87 per cent of women fantasise about having sex with more than one person at a time. This documentary follows a group of first-timers as they go after their ultimate erotic experience, while also meeting those who have already been there to answer key question, such as how do you find people and what is it like to see your partner with someone else?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee accountant Annika hosts the first dinner party in Boston, Lincolnshire, where she hopes to impress farmer's wife Carolyn, electrical engineer Adrian, carer Sylwia, and glamorous mum Katy with an evening modelled on a country fayre

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Competitions fanatic Katy hosts the second night in Boston, Lincolnshire, where she aims to impress her guests with her organisation skills and a menu featuring savoury profiteroles. However, fellow contestant Carolyn is critical of the food, and lone male host Adrian struggles to feel included when the conversation turns to hair extensions and fake eyelashes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third night of the competition in Boston, Lincolnshire, Adrian hopes that his spicy food and surprises will help him scoop the £1,000 prize. Although he was quiet at the table the previous night, Adrian goes on the charm offensive and seems to be impressing his guests - but he may have gone a step too far with his final revelation

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Polish-born carer Sylwia hosts the fourth party of the competition in Boston, Lincolnshire, and hopes her European menu will charm her guests. However, the growing friction between diners Annika and Carolyn threatens to spoil the evening, and the host's chances of winning the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party night in Boston, and the hard-to-please foxhunter Carolyn is planning on using a charm offensive to win over the guests after having criticised each of them during the week. She has offended Annika, called Katy fake, found fault with Sylwia's food, and reprimanded Adie, but still believes she may be able to turn things around

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Colin and Alison Jenkins have always lived in the same West Yorkshire village, but they're keen travellers and fell in love with Barbados when they first visited 13 years ago. Now they want the island to be part of their early retirement plans and are looking for a home to eventually spend six months a year in. Scarlette Douglas shows them five potentially suitable properties for their £275,000 budget on the island's lively south coast

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Musical couple Paul and Judith Corazzo from Dorset have been dreaming of buying a holiday home in sunny Spain, where they can escape from their hectic work lives back in the UK. For their budget of £140,000, Jasmine Harman shows them five properties to consider its La Marina Alta region

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two B&B owners prepare to open their business in France while also planning their wedding. There is heartbreak in Spain for the motorbike tour operators

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Windsor, Berkshire, the first to host is estate agent Vikki who's hoping to bag the £1000 prize by hosting a ladies day-themed dinner party. The guests she's hoping to impress are entrepreneur and self-proclaimed winner Mohinder, local radio DJ Mary, 66-year-old football-loving Angie and second-hand car dealer Robert. With some gamey golfers, difficult diners and cutting commentary, it promises to be a night her guests won't forget in a hurry

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night in Windsor, and radio DJ Mary hosts an evening featuring traditional Irish dishes like vegetable soup, steak with champ, and an Eton Mess with a twist

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Windsor is outspoken entrepreneur Mohinder, who hopes to impress his fellow guests with an ambitious menu featuring tulips and a cauliflower foam

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Windsor is hosted by retired sales manager Angie, who is planning some 1960s fun. However, her guests are not impressed by the rules she lays down at the beginning

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Windsor, Berkshire, car salesman Rob unleashes the mother of all surprises on his guests, welcoming them to his enormous country mansion complete with swimming pool and Ferrari. Estate agent Vicky and radio DJ Mary are smitten by Rob and his house, but for entrepreneur Mohinder it's all too much as he's completely upstaged and realises he is no longer leader of the pack

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Father and son Michael and Sami want to buy a holiday home in Malaga on Spain's Costa del Sol, so Laura Hamilton lines up fives properties within their budget of £280,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sue and Simon Parry from Bedfordshire are looking for a second home on the Costa Tropical, where they plan to spend up to three quarters of the year enjoying the glorious Spanish sunshine. Using their £140,000 budget, Laura Hamilton lines up five options for the pair to consider, but will any of them fit the bill?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were at very different stages in their lives. In 2016, Kirstie Allsopp searched around Warrington for childhood sweethearts Andy and Jen, who were ready to start a family. Back in 2017, Phil helped Kent converts Rich and Debs find a new home with a sea view. Now, Phil returns to find out if both couples are happy in their new homes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets south London chef Corinne, who loves to entertain and is rustling up plans for a beautifully crafted, double-kitchen home designed around her love of cooking. The end-of-terrace plot is on a hill and surrounded by woodland within a strict conservation area, so it won't be an easy build. But having come through a divorce and cancer treatment, Corinne sees the house as vital on so many levels, not least as an opportunity to create a space that represents her new lease of life

programme.title: Meet the Parents (2000)
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The comics take part in another selection of challenges, highlights of which include Jenny Eclair having a lovely time sitting on a chair while new potatoes cascade onto her head. Elsewhere, things get emotional - who can keep it together for the all-important sausage quiz? Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Mae Martin and Kiell Smith-Bynoe are the other four contestants competing for Greg Davies's golden head

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding invite Paddy McGuinness, Coleen Nolan, Joe Thomas and Ellie Taylor into the tent to face three challenges set by judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. The contestants are asked to make Jaffa cakes, take the rough with the smooth in the pastry Technical, and render their home towns in biscuit for their showstoppers

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: Jack Russell Bertie loves to bark - and brothers Sherlock, Dobbie and Gizmo are only too eager to join the chorus. However, the incessant barking is a cause of worry for husbands Andy and Rich, so they call upon trainers Nanci and Jo to help calm this cacophonous quartet. Plus, a wife seeks help calming her 18-month-old cockapoo Freddie, as his behaviour is terrifying her husband

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. In the first episode, a terrified terrier known as Tiny arrives after his owner of five years is taken into care, while child-friendly Daisy, a Cairn terrier, is the only one of Wood Green's charges deemed gentle enough for the Kerry family from Peterborough. Plus, Jack Russell Mozart and Zeus, a recently abandoned Staffordshire bull terrier, each try to charm couple Paul and Elf

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Dream Kitchens & Bathrooms with Mark Millar
programme.desc: Mark Millar helps create a dream Victorian-style bathroom for £3,000 in Lincolnshire for crystal-ball seller Abi and handyman husband Simon, including roll-top bath, high-cistern toilet and an upcycled vanity unit. Elsewhere in Staffordshire, Mark meets project engineer Kevin and nurse Michele who have a big budget of £40,000 to create a farmhouse-feel kitchen

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Two expats buy the bar they discovered on their honeymoon 21 years before, while a tattooist moonlights as both a reggae singer and a DIY visual artist. A Scottish couple bought a bargain Segway business, but making it work takes a lot of hard graft

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: Documentary following shopping centre security teams who are locked in a cat and mouse battle to catch criminals using every excuse and trick to evade capture. At Weston Favell in Northampton, Cliff is alerted to a woman who is onto her second store of what appears to be a shoplifting spree, while security guard Paul takes a call about a group of women who have been seen on CCTV taking items from a high street store at West Orchards Shopping Centre in Coventry

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting alarming tales from all sides of the buy-to-let system, from unruly tenants and rogue landlords to dishonest letting agents. In Wigan, letting agents Karen and Gemma have no idea that a routine inspection is about to turn into one of the worst hoarding cases they have ever seen. Meanwhile in Blackpool, John tries to evict a difficult tenant who has been caught stealing electricity on more than one occasion

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A dangerous driver pushes officers to their limit in Derbyshire as the vehicle reaches speeds of over 150 miles an hour, before crashing into a ravine. Meanwhile on the outskirts of Derby, traffic officer Jason deals with a suspected drunk driver sighted walking down a busy dual carriageway after crashing her car

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The pubs finally reopen after nearly four months of lockdown and as a result the police prepare for a spike in drink-drive incidents on Derbyshire's roads. Paul investigates a report of a crash involving a car that has gone straight over a roundabout and then been abandoned, while Scott is called to a report of an alleged hit-and-run - which transpires to be the result of a fight between a pub-goers that spiralled out of control and into the path of oncoming motorists

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The interceptors' skills are put to the test as they go in hot pursuit of tearaway teens and reckless youths. Jacko is on the hunt for a wanted teenager after he disappears in a housing estate and the interceptors are also hot on the heels of a stolen silver Micra

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jacko has to deal with a suspected drug dealer who seems to have found a novel way of hiding his stash, and Mark and Steve stop a suspicious man trying to hide his true identity. Meanwhile, after a high-speed pursuit, interceptor Liam hunts down a wanted teenager

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: In this special edition, Ortis Deley and Rick Edwards join police using cutting-edge technology to crack down on crime, including tiny thermal-imaging cameras, handheld fingerprint sensors and tracking drones. Ortis joins Cheshire interceptors on a thrilling motorway pursuit, while Rick and the team tackle a drug driver and officers discover a massive cannabis farm

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: Security guards in West Orchards shopping centre in Coventry try to tackle the issue of serial shoplifters, who are behind around 70 per cent of all the thefts in the centre. At Weston Favell Shopping Centre in Northampton, the security team have their eye on a duo suspected of repeatedly shoplifting using young children as decoys

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ava jumps at any chance to be around Theo. Kirby is amused by the teenager's harmless crush. A vulnerable Bree asks Remi to wait for her

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Rattled by her returning memories of Cash, Eden is not ready to face him. A technology-challenged Alf struggles to tolerate the modern world closing in

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following Noel and Sue Radford as they cope with their supersized family, as well as grandchildren, dogs, teenage parties and home-schooling. 18-year-old Millie has a baby of her own, and 25-year-old Chloe is house hunting with her new boyfriend. Later, the whole extended brood come together for a joyful double christening to welcome Bonnie and Heidie, the newest members of this great big family

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A special episode from Horfield Health Centre in Bristol, shining a light on the trials and joys of being a pensioner in the UK in 2017. First through Dr Ramshaw's consulting room door is Roy, a sprightly 92-year-old, whose carpal tunnel syndrome keeps him awake at night, while Dr Cordell treats Angela, who has a persistent nosebleed and has started seeing strange lights in her field of vision

programme.title: Rich Kids Go Skint
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Mimi leaves her privileged life in the Surrey countryside to live with Kerena and her daughters, who survive on Universal Credit in a mould-infected house

Father of four Ian is rushed in after suffering a cardiac arrest, while another man is bleeding so heavily he risks losing his entire circulatory system. Meanwhile, Ken has fallen from a roof onto a skip, leaving him with a gaping wound to his thigh and potentially life-threatening injuries to his pelvis and spine, and Dr Nayak helps Michael, who has suffered a severe stroke

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Paramedics rush in a teenager who has suffered major trauma when his car left the road and hit a tree, while a 56-year-old in resus needs a dislocated shoulder popping back into place. An 86-year-old man has complications from flu

programme.title: Evil Up Close: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: The case of Stephen Hough, who brutally killed an innocent schoolgirl in 1976 when he was just 16. But in a shocking turn of events, he was caught and sent to prison 41 years later

programme.title: The Girl in the Cellar: 8 Years Underground
programme.desc: For the first time, Natascha Kampusch tells the harrowing story of her abduction as a 10-year-old in Vienna in 1998, and the 3,096 days she spent held captive in a secret basement.. Natascha speaks openly about her horrific experiences, and reveals how the conspiracy theories and lack of public empathy have impacted her life in the years following her ordeal

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun

What her neighbours don't know is that plans for a new caravan park are afoot, and Bambi's bosses have asked her to relocate. Narrated by John Thomson

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Letting agents Karen and Gemma investigate claims of vandalism and anti-social behaviour at a property they manage in Wigan, but when they discover the tenant is no longer living there, they track her down to learn that she's abandoned the property and has tried to move in somewhere else by forging a reference. Meanwhile, in Darwen, letting agent Paul issues proceedings on a tenant who is more than £3,000 in arrears, but Paul's attempts at evicting him are delayed when the tenant refuses to leave without Paul giving him a good reference

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A scooter is driven the wrong way down a dual carriageway into oncoming traffic, but despite it having its tyres stung and being followed by a police helicopter, it proves incredibly difficult to apprehend the rider. A chase nearly ends in serious injury for an officer when he is almost dragged along by a car after it is cornered in a supermarket car park

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: After receiving reports that a lorry driver has almost struck a road worker on the M1, officers race to intercept a seven-and-a-half-ton truck, with Sgt Scott Riley deploying a stinger to bring the vehicle to a standstill. PC Chris Ryan receives a police camera alert that the driver in the car in front of him may under the influence of drugs, while Sgt Steve Hughes and his team investigate a crash in which a car hit a wall

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Cameras follow elite teams from the Durham and Cleveland forces as they tackle young, reckless drivers who cause carnage on the roads and put themselves and others in danger. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Tattoo Disasters UK
programme.desc: Featuring Tom whose fiancee Jennifer has issued an ultimatum - get rid of the images of three of his ex-girlfriends on his body or the wedding is off. Plus, musician Emilia, who got a tattoo of a bar of music before making a grizzly discovery - the notes play the funeral march

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Assertive Ziggy marches into the hospital demanding medical attention for baby Izzy. Too proud to accept help, Alf suffers in silence, trying to teach himself the new IT software

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homicide police hand the case of a retired marine colonel found murdered with an axe over to NCIS when they are unable to solve the case, despite all the circumstantial evidence pointing to the deceased's drug-addicted son. They discover the suspect's mother went missing two years previously and Ziva suggests he may have killed more than one parent, while the family's neighbour is revealed to also have had a motive for wanting the man dead. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a marine working for the Defence Intelligence Agency who was blamed for the disappearance of 500 specialised rifles in Afghanistan. A cryptic message found at the scene, written in the victim's blood, leads the agents on the trail of a controversial manuscript that claims to expose the truth about the missing weapons, and an FBI agent with a secret. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents examine the death of a seaman and find themselves working alongside Barrett. Gibbs makes his displeasure about the circumstances of the case well known, prompting the rest of the investigators to worry that he might be about to leave the NCIS again. Meanwhile, Ziva introduces her new boyfriend to her team-mates. Crime drama, guest starring Enrique Murciano

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A baby is found dead in his cot, and reports indicate he was poisoned. All the evidence pins the blame on a British au pair employed by the parents, but she claims the infant's death was a result of the mother's negligence. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe, Curtis, McCoy and Kincaid witness the execution of a criminal they helped bring to justice, but the event culminates in personal tragedies for each of them

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the abduction and murder of a teacher, and later discover it's possible that she knew the culprit. Having arrested one of her students, the courts quickly decide their evidence is inadmissible - but it seems another assailant could be to blame. Benjamin Bratt and Jerry Orbach star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The shooting of a sleazy retired policeman in a neighbourhood notorious for prostitution leads Briscoe and Curtis to two suburban housewives who are secretly moonlighting. However, it soon becomes apparent that whoever killed the victim could have been acting in self-defence. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: First of a three-part story. The team investigates when the headless corpse of a film studio executive is found floating in a river, and her personal trainer and ex-husband soon prove likely suspects. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU tackle a wave of hate crimes on Christmas Eve, while Rollins reconnects with an old flame

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate the murder of a man who had been tried and acquitted of murdering his first wife 10 years before and went on to present a TV programme re-examining cases in which people had been wrongly accused by the police. They discover two friends were meant to have gone swimming with the victim at the time of his death, but had been tricked into staying away, and find themselves examining the past of ADA Mulrooney, whose career had been hampered by his involvement in the previous case

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is found to be having a sexual relationship with one of her daughter's classmates, and investigations reveal she may also have supplied alcohol for a high-school party at which another student died. Guest starring Becca Mills (Grey's Anatomy) and Laura Leighton (Melrose Place)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson is forced to cooperate with an FBI agent trying to track down her brother, who is fleeing sexual assault charges. However, the pressure proves too much for her to handle, and she loses control during another case, prompting Cragen to send her home. Guest starring Vincent Spano (Rumble Fish), with Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Two children are found handcuffed to their seats but miraculously alive in the back of a van submerged in a river. The ensuing investigation links the case to a mysterious death involving a controversial therapy technique, and eventually leads the team to a seemingly abusive foster family. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Logan and Briscoe investigate when members of a bachelor party watch an amateur video that appears to depict a girl's rape and murder. However, their inquiries reveal the apparent victim is alive, but has fallen foul of a points-for-sex club at her prestigious high-school

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: The fallen angel decides the only way to get over his infatuation with Chloe is to seduce her, and Amenadiel confronts Maze over his concerns about her devilish master

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Officers in Huntingdon explain that they had a problem with regular drunken violence at weekends, but that CCTV is at the forefront of their initiative to turn things around. Nick Wallis also discovers how CCTV is helping Chester's local council and the police manage problems on Race Day

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant is found dead in the Pentagon's custodial closet, and surveillance footage indicates she was killed by a co-worker. However, Ziva and the team discover her supposed assailant actually died of a heart attack days before the crime was committed. Meanwhile, suspicions are raised regarding the eyeball left in Tony's drink, and the investigators' attention is fixed on the port-to-port murderer, who appears to still be at large

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony's one-time Baltimore PD partner Danny Price is murdered in a manner that suggests the port-to-port killer has struck again. However, a key difference in the way the victim was bound suggests the crime was actually the work of a copycat, forcing the investigators to consider whether Price had any enemies

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New evidence reveals the serial killer has infiltrated the agency and is targeting a member of the NCIS team, prompting Gibbs to seek the guidance of his former mentor Mike Franks. A lead from Barrett's squad reveals the CIA has also been tracking the murderer - and its findings suggest the culprit could be an even deadlier foe than anticipated

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman's body is found in a lift, and McCoy finds his prosecution of the prime suspect hampered by a vindictive judge Ross offended in court

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A student is found stabbed to death in his flat, and a college friend is soon named prime suspect - but she claims the victim was a stranger who used a date rape drug on her. However, it soon emerges that the crime could have been racially motivated. Drama, with Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a rare coin dealer, focusing their efforts on a millionaire who seems the most likely culprit - but Ross finds himself forced to play detective too. Sam Waterson and Jerry Orbach star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Conclusion of a three-part story. The investigation into a movie studio boss's murder becomes further complicated when fresh evidence points to yet another suspect. Meanwhile, the ex-husband of the deceased goes to trial to face accusations of having a hand in the crime - is an innocent man about to be convicted? Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A carjacking turns nasty when an off-duty police officer is killed and the driver is kidnapped. Luckily, Briscoe and Curtis capture one of the perpetrators, who offers to reveal the whereabouts of the missing driver to DA Ross - in exchange for immunity on the cop-killing charge. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An estate agent and two clients discover the body of Lt Com Maya Burris, a naval attache who had been working in Egypt, and her detective husband Nick arrives on the scene to demand answers. Using documents discovered on the victim's boat, Abby links her to Barry Norton, who is suspected of having sold government secrets to a Middle Eastern terrorist group known as the SRC

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU is assigned to profile an unidentified suspect responsible for killing two people whose bodies have been found with nearly 50 stab wounds each. What first appears to be the work of a disorganised gang is revealed to be the actions of a man prone to traumatic hallucinations, and the team needs to discover the root of his problems before he kills again

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents go on the trail of a female serial killer and find themselves searching for a suspect driven by her own grief. The team members also attend individual therapy sessions to help deal with the loss of their friend and colleague. Crime drama, starring Joe Mantegna

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A CIA agent's fiancee is raped and murdered by a professional hitman, suggesting an assassination, but the detectives suspect a man resembling the victim's partner could have invented the story to cover up an affair. Crime drama, guest starring Dylan Walsh (Nip/Tuck), with Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A boy's mutilated body is found in a basement, raising suspicions that he fell victim to a sex offender living in the area. However, another youngster later alleges he died accidentally during an illegal fight club bout - leading Benson and Stabler to an unexpected discovery. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler struggle to identify the cause of a woman's death in Central Park, and follow a trail of clues that leads to a mute homeless man, who turns out to be a better witness than anticipated. After they discover a rare toxic agent was the murder weapon, and that the victim was a millionaire, they suspect her husband could be the culprit because his dance troupe had been in financial difficulty. Guest starring Chris Sarandon (ER), with Mariska Harqitay and Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An autistic man dies in police custody, and when Briscoe and Logan investigate, they discover he was receiving a number of unusual and illegal treatments. The inquiry also sheds light on the deceased's parents, who seem reluctant to pursue a prosecution

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: The fallen angel develops a lust for danger after hearing about the death of a young woman during a shooting at a fashion show. Meanwhile, Maze admits she wants to go back to Hell

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
